instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-3476: What is 820-3476? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3476</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Boots fully, no display no backlight
threads.message:
Working on a <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3476</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>. It will boot fully (sometimes it says aloud "to choose english as your language press the return key), but no display via internal screen or thunderbolt display.

Doesn't appear to have liquid damage anywhere.  not getting enables on <CHIP>U8330</CHIP>.  if i remove <CHIP>U8330</CHIP> and hot wire the enables the backlight will turn on, and the screen will get power at the connector.  HPD 2.5v at <RESISTOR>R8301</RESISTOR>.  i2c at connector appears to all be there.  nothing measurable on the EDP termination resistors, but the resistors themselves are 1M to ground

Pram reset successfully, but no change, same for SMC reset.  

known good screen, put a known good logic board in the chassis and all worked.

looks like the enables come directly from <CHIP>U0500</CHIP> (cpu), so i suspect something isn't happening to tell the CPU to take those high, but i cant figure out what could possibly be missing. Especially given that it boots fully.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3476</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Boots fully, no display no backlight
threads.message:
you might get to see an external display if you disconnect the internal display cable first.

check if you get any voltage on L8300 for a few seconds when it boots up. it should have least 5v even if you don't have a screen connected,

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3476</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Boots fully, no display no backlight
threads.message:
With internal screen disconnected, no external display. Also, SMC lid is working correctly as well. L8300 will indeed go high (5V) briefly on initial startup.

swapped <CHIP>U8340</CHIP> from a donor board to no change. Was hoping for a HPD translation issue, no luck.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3476</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Boots fully, no display no backlight
threads.message:
J8300 pin 9 goes to 2.5V when you have 5V at pins 28-30?
LCD must be connected.
If not, display is not recognized and 5V dissapears.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3476</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Boots fully, no display no backlight
threads.message: Pin 9 will go to 2.5V while the 5v is present.  It disappears as the 5V disappears.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3476</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Boots fully, no display no backlight
threads.message: <SIGNAL>DP_INT_HPD</SIGNAL> goes to 3V at the same time?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3476</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Boots fully, no display no backlight
threads.message:
<SIGNAL>DP_INT_HPD</SIGNAL> goes to 3.3V from about 1/2 second before fan spin, and remains at 3.3V indefinitely. Being attached to logic level shifter, this must be a binary signal. Dont have a scope here at the moment, but can grab one tomorrow. Is there any documentation of what the HPD handshake is supposed to look like? If im even on the right track with the HPD signal, please feel free to ignore me if you have further diagnosis steps

EDIT:   <SIGNAL>DP_INT_HPD</SIGNAL> indeed drops to 0 as the 2.5v drops to zero.  Not sure what happened on that first measurement, but now it consistently drops down

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3476</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Boots fully, no display no backlight
threads.message:
If HPD drops, LCD communication is lost.
No image, nor backlight possible then...
Did you try known good LCD assembly?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3476</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Boots fully, no display no backlight
threads.message: Yes, lcd is known good.  I put another logic board in the machine and the LCD works perfectly.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3476</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Boots fully, no display no backlight
threads.message:
If you don't get external video, looks like Intel graphics is dead...
Check around CPU for any knocked off, or moved component.
Try new BIOS, just in case.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3476</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Boots fully, no display no backlight
threads.message: swapped EFI chip from donor board. No change.  Nothing obviously missing around cpu.   Very strange issue.....

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3476</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Boots fully, no display no backlight
threads.message: Just gonna bump this.  Was hoping for something a little more detailed than the intel gpu being "dead"
